result.execSummary:
The defendant Jina M. Savaglio was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Kenosha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jina M. Savaglio

records.addlTxt: As a condition of probation - 90 days KCJ

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody pro se.  Atty Cassi Baumgardner present - reports she cannot represent the deft since the deft does NOT qualify for PD presentation.  Deft wishes to proceed pro se.  Agent Jennifer Merlin present.  Deft wishes to proceed with the hrg today.  Brief remarks made.  Deft sentenced to 90 days KCJ as a condition of probation.
from Agent Merlin
Per Court, no action needed on the violation the deft had - "disturbance w/son"
Email received from Agent Merlin - deft was placed a PO hold due to intoxication and disturbance w/son
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Cassi Baumgardner.  Case is resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  Deft pleads guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for one year.  See conditions.  DNA ordered.  Appeal rights.  NOTE - deft taken into custody on warrant from Columbia County.
Jury selection at 03-21-2016 09:00 am
